title: Bank of England’s Andrew Bailey sees signs of ‘somewhat stronger ’ UK growth

title: Rishi Sunak issues warning over Labour as Brits urged not to fall for Keir Starmer's 'con'

title: Two schools forced to shut after concrete falls from ceiling
description: Two schools have closed and another two are shut to certain year groups after falling concrete prompted safety inspections.

title: Biden Teases Super Bowl Conspiracy With ‘Dark Brandon’ Meme After Chiefs Win
description: President Joe Biden likely sent conspiracy theorists into a frenzy late Sunday by teasingly suggesting the Kansas City Chiefs’ Super Bowl win was indeed a deep-state plot. “Just like we drew it up,” he posted on X, the social media site formerly known as Twitter, following the Chiefs’ nail-biting 25-22 victory in overtime.

title: Sunak hopes to shrug off bad economic news with OBR forecast allowing tax cuts

title: SNP demand clarity on free tuition fee stance from Scottish Tories
description: “With the Tories planning to impose backdoor tuition fees, and Keir Starmer’s breaking his pledge on free tuition, it’s clear that only the SNP will stand up for Scotland’s students, and make sure a university education is based on the ability to learn and not the ability to pay.”

title: Tories slump to their lowest poll rating with Rishi as PM with Labour lead surging to 25 points at start of what could be one of Sunak's worst weeks in No10
description: The latest Redfield & Wilton Strategies survey showed the Conservatives on just 21 per cent support among voters, which is down three points since last week.

title: Empty council offices could 'solve homelessness and rough sleeping' in Salford
description: Empty council offices should be used to help people who are homeless or rough sleeping in Salford, a councillor has said. Offices in Salford Civic Centre in Swinton are often left empty when staff work from home, Councillor Robin Garrido said.

title: 'Conservatives' lack of plan led to lacking NHS services in Devizes'
description: “Was it part of the plan not to hold NHS Property Services to account, when they sold the NHS clinic in New Park Street to Majestic, or for leaving the Devizes Community Hospital in a state of decline over many years - apart from moving the clinics to it, of course - until now when they are starting the process of trying to sell it off?

title: Tories ‘could lose more than half of England’s 100 most rural seats’
description: The Conservatives could lose more than half of the 100 most rural seats in England at the election, according to a poll that has dealt another blow to Rishi Sunak. The Survation survey showed that Labour holds a lead in the polls in the seats, which have traditionally formed Conservative heartlands.

description: The Labour Party now holds a poll lead over the Tories in England’s 100 most rural constituencies in a fresh blow for Rishi Sunak. title: Edinburgh Castle's Redcoat Cafe re-opening upsets independence supporters despite same name for 30 years

title: Bonus ban for water bosses who break rules with illegal sewage spills
description: Water company bosses are set to be banned from receiving bonuses if their companies let illegal sewage spills pollute beaches and rivers.
